SELECT s.sign_id, s.user_id, s.sign_time, s.sign_year, s.sign_month, s.sign_day, s.continuous_day, u.user_name, u2.user_name top_name, u3.user_name manager_name, u4.user_name agent_name FROM pan_sign_record s LEFT JOIN sys_user u ON u.user_id = s.user_id left join sys_user u2 on u.top_id = u2.user_id left join sys_user u3 on u.manager_id = u3.user_id LEFT JOIN sys_user u4 ON u4.user_id = u.agent_id
and u.user_name like concat('%',#{userName}) and u.top_id = #{topId} and u.manager_id = #{managerId} and u.agent_id = #{agentId} and u2.user_name = #{topName} and u3.user_name = #{managerName} and u4.user_name = #{agentName}
AND DATE_FORMAT(s.sign_time,'%Y-%m-%d') >= DATE_FORMAT( #{params.beginTime},'%Y-%m-%d')
AND DATE_FORMAT(s.sign_time,'%Y-%m-%d') <= DATE_FORMAT( #{params.endTime},'%Y-%m-%d')
order by s.sign_time desc

SELECT sign_id, user_id, sign_time, sign_year, sign_month, sign_day, continuous_day FROM pan_sign_record
and user_id = #{userId} and sign_year = #{signYear} and sign_month = #{signMonth} and sign_day = #{signDay}

SELECT b.sign_id, b.user_id, b.sign_time, b.sign_year, b.sign_month, b.sign_day, b.continuous_day FROM ( SELECT max( sign_id ) AS sgin_Id, user_id FROM pan_sign_record WHERE user_id = #{userId} GROUP BY user_id ) a LEFT JOIN pan_sign_record b ON a.user_id = b.user_id AND a.sgin_Id = b.sign_id;
